title: Mike Woodard (baseball)
text:
Michael Cary Woodard (born March 2, 1960 in <a href="Melrose%20Park%2C%20Illinois">Melrose Park, Illinois</a>) is an American former <a href="professional%20baseball">professional baseball</a> player. He played all or part of four seasons in <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a> (MLB), from 1985 through 1988, for the <a href="San%20Francisco%20Giants">San Francisco Giants</a> (1985–87) and <a href="Chicago%20White%20Sox">Chicago White Sox</a> (1988), primarily as a <a href="second%20baseman">second baseman</a>. He batted <a href="left-handed">left-handed</a> and threw <a href="right-handed">right-handed</a>.
In his major league career, Woodard had a batting average of .222, going 50-for-225, with one <a href="home%20run">home run</a> and 19 <a href="run%20batted%20in">RBI</a>s in 100 <a href="games%20played">games</a>, including 29 <a href="run%20%28baseball%29">runs</a>, four <a href="double%20%28baseball%29">doubles</a>, two <a href="triple%20%28baseball%29">triples</a>, and 14 <a href="stolen%20base">stolen base</a>s.
